title: Who was the last ruling king in India? - Quora

response.answer_text: Kshemaka is the last king after Pariskhit, Janamejaya etc, andthe kali yuga has started now and around 5000 years completed out of 4,32000 yearsand it is the just beginning of kali yuga the details may be obtained from Srimad Bhagavatha where the details of kings ruled are given after Pariskhit. it is very important that Sri Vedavyas gives answers to all the questions since HE is sarvagna and knows in advance what type of questions can come in future all are replied one should study and enjoy the sacred texts which gives peace of mind not only that we also prosper in our life by just reading/ hearing the Mahabharatha pravachana but please do not take the T V serial as an authentic version, but adhere to the original text which it is available in Udupi Sri Krishna mutt in sanskrit and kannada languages and attempts are being made to get in other languages also . Number of people were involved and around 30, 000 manuscripts were screened with different slokas and the original text was derived from these different versions after lot of evaluation

In context of the Mughal emperor it was Bahadur Shah Zafar who was ruling India when the east India company usurped the empire.After the first war of independence in 1857 his sons were killed and he was send to rangoon for exile where he died ,since then until Independence we were under British rule
